quote: Chance corrects us of many faults that reason would not know how to correct.
Observe your enemies, for they first find out your faults.
Our friends don't see our faults, or conceal them, or soften them.
A benevolent man should allow a few faults in himself, to keep his friends in countenance.
A friend should always underestimate your virtues and an enemy overestimate your faults.
A woman's faults, be they never so small, cast a shadow which all her virtues cannot dispel.
All faults may be forgiven of him who has perfect candor.
Bad people excuse their faults; wise people leave them.
Be England what she will, with all her faults she is my country still.
Be to their virtue very kind; be to their faults a little blind.
Dishonest people conceal their faults from themselves as well as others, honest people know and confess them.
Chance corrects us of many faults that reason would not know how to correct.
Observe your enemies, for they first find out your faults.
Our friends don't see our faults, or conceal them, or soften them.
A benevolent man should allow a few faults in himself, to keep his friends in countenance.
A friend should always underestimate your virtues and an enemy overestimate your faults.
A woman's faults, be they never so small, cast a shadow which all her virtues cannot dispel.
All faults may be forgiven of him who has perfect candor.
Bad people excuse their faults; wise people leave them.
Be England what she will, with all her faults she is my country still.
Be to their virtue very kind; be to their faults a little blind.
Dishonest people conceal their faults from themselves as well as others, honest people know and confess them.
Egotism is the source and summary of all faults and miseries.
Egotism is the source and summary of all faults and miseries.
Every man should keep a fair-sized cemetery in which to bury the faults of his friends.
Everyone has his faults which he continually repeats: neither fear nor shame can cure them.
Faults are beauties in a lovers eye.
Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.
Had we not faults of our own, we should take less pleasure in complaining of others.
I like a friend the better for having faults that one can talk about.
If we had no faults of our own, we should not take so much pleasure in noticing those in others.
It is the peculiar quality of a fool to perceive the faults of others and to forget his own.
Keep a fair-sized cemetery in your back yard, in which to bury the faults of your friends.
Life has taught me that it is not for our faults that we are disliked and even hated, but for our qualities.
Love your enemies, for they tell you your faults.
Love yourself unconditionally, just as you love those closest to you despite their faults.
Men's faults to themselves seldom appear.
My friend is he who will tell me my faults in private.
Never exaggerate your faults, your friends will attend to that.
None of us can stand other people having the same faults as ourselves.
Not to alter one's faults is to be faulty indeed.
O, what a world of vile ill-favored faults, looks handsome in three hundred pounds a year!
Of all acts of man repentance is the most divine. The greatest of all faults is to be conscious of none.
Our own self-love draws a thick veil between us and our faults.
People do not mind their faults being spread out before them, but they become impatient if called on to give them up.
Psychiatry enables us to correct our faults by confessing our parents shortcomings.
Self-love exaggerates our faults as well as our virtues.
The common faults of American language are an ambition of effect, a want of simplicity, and a turgid abuse of terms.
The essence of a man is found in his faults.
The faults of the burglar are the qualities of the financier.
The greatest of all faults, I should say, is to be conscious of none.
The greatest of faults, I should say, is to be conscious of none.
The real fault is to have faults and not amend them.
There are people who in spite of their merit disgust us, and others who please us in spite of their faults.
They say men are molded out of faults, and for the most, become much more the better; for being a little bad.
Think not those faithful who praise all thy words and actions, but those who kindly reprove thy faults.
To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.
Trust no friend without faults, and love a woman, but no angel.
We are great and our faults are great and therefore our problems great and great are our consolations.
We confess our little faults to persuade people that we have no large ones.
We forget our faults easily when they are known to ourselves alone.
We must not take the faults of our youth with us into old age, for age brings along its own defects.
We only confess our little faults to persuade people that we have no big ones.
When you have faults, do not fear to abandon them.
While fools shun one set of faults they run into the opposite one.
Why do we discover faults so much more readily than perfection.
auther: Marie de Rabutin-Chantal marquise de  Sévigné
